p: Other recent legislation is designed to protect union finances. A New Jersey law prohibits employers from encouraging employees to abandon the union or cease payroll deduction of dues (N.J. Stat. Ann. § 34:13A-5.14 2018). New York law provides for payroll deduction of dues upon employee authorization and allows unions to use the authorization to define the terms under which revocation of the authorization is permissible (N.Y. Civ. Serv. Law §§ 93-b, 201, 208, 209-a 2017). Several other states have similar provisions, while New Jersey and Hawaii limited revocation periods by statute (Fisk and Malin 2019, 1858–59).
